```{r DIL Boxplot, message=FALSE}
library(plyr)
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(scales)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
#options(digits=3) # zeigt nur drei Zahlenwerte an

DIL_mean_boxplot <- read_csv2('data/DIL_1.csv')

#max <-max(DIL_mean_boxplot$Mittelwert)
#min <-min(DIL_mean_boxplot$Mittelwert)

Boost_mean_boxplot <- read_csv2('data/BoostA1n_1.csv')


DIL_mean_boxplot <- distinct(DIL_mean_boxplot, Mittelwert) # aus dem ursprünglichen tibble wird nur die column Mittelwert behalten
DIL_mean_boxplot
Boost_mean_boxplot <- distinct(Boost_mean_boxplot, Mittelwert)
Boost_mean_boxplot
#ddply(DIL_absolut, .(), transform, relchange2 = ((100 / Mittelwert[1]) * Mittelwert) - 100) # alternative Berechnung fuer relative Differenzen zum Ausgangswert in der 1. Reihe  

DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot <- ddply(DIL_mean_boxplot, .(), transform, Mittelwert.1 = (DIL_mean_boxplot / Boost_mean_boxplot[1]))
DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot
#DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot_table <<- ddply(DIL_mean_boxplot, .(), transform, Mittelwert.1  = (DIL_mean_boxplot / Boost_mean_boxplot[1]))



DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot_table <- DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot %>% rename('Fraction' = '.id') #renmae column '.id' with 'Fraction'
DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot_table 

#DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot_table[1:14, 1] = (1:14) 

DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot_table %>%
  kable(align = c("ccccccccc"), escape = FALSE, format ='html', caption = "DIL descriptive statistics") %>%
kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed"), 
   full_width = TRUE) 



par(bty="n") # keinen Rahmen
par(family="serif") # Schriftart
par(mar = c(5, 6, 2, 2)) # Abstände um den Plot. 2. Position y-Achse
par(mgp=c(4.2,1,0)) # mpg: Abstand Label zu Achse
boxplot(DIL_Boost_mean_rel_boxplot_table$Mittelwert.1, 
      ylab= "Dose in Gray", #y-Achse-Beschriftung  
 yaxt="n", #suppresses y-axis. Brauch ich das? 
      col="transparent", #Farbe des Boxplots
     las = 2, # horizontale Markierung der Tick-Beschriftungen
   # ylim=c(min(0.995*min), max(1.005*max)), # y-Achse range
        cex.lab = 2, # Größe Label-Beschriftung
        cex.axis = 1.5, # Größe Achsenbeschriftungen
        mgp=c(2.5,0.2,0), # mpg: Abstand Label zu Achse
    #  , xpd = TRUE
      labels = FALSE
        )

```
